creator: davidsk

content:
Thunderbird is a email client that you can manage one or more email address in like @gmail.com or the thousands other email service options out there.

Thunderbird is not a email provider nor a server as there is no official @thunderbird.xyz email for public to sign up on and use or such.

Neither the company Mozilla or the Mozilla Foundation's subsidiary MZLA Technologies Corporation that makes the Thunderbird email client has any form of email services for the public. Mozilla does have *@mozilla.com/*@mozilla.org email however they are only manually provided to those who work for Mozilla in a capacity that warrants getting one as they have to give it up when they leave and are not available to the general public.

Btw this is a Support Forum and nobody here does replies by publicly posted email address and do post a subject for your support forum threads instead of just .....
creator: James

creator: jimhurley1

content: Ok, highlighting and pressing Delete key is probably not the solution you seek, so I presume there are many messages to keep, and others to delete. You could create a filter that selects a date range and set the action to move to trash. That would let you selectively empty from that time frame. Or am I still misunderstanding?
creator: davidsk

content: How do I do that. I see the Quick Filter box, or do I need to go somewhere else.
creator: jimhurley1

content: go to tools>message filters. There, create a filter for manual running that is always true, e.g. subject does not contain xxxxxx and an additional test for date prior to a specified date. For action, move to trash, NOT delete. Then, if you made a mistake, you can retrieve from trash. after creating filter, there will be an open row at bottom where you can specify a folder, such as inbox, and a button to run the filter.

content: Thunderbird didn't produce that popup, Google did. Google is asking your approval to authorize the use of the Thunderbird email client to be your agent in writing messages, reading messages and deleting messages. This is part of the Google security envelope. This is not a scam.
creator: davidsk

content: How do I stop it?
creator: mlmiller1

content: Technically, Thunderbird is your agent for all emails accounts you use. That is , it performs the actions you request, such as sending , receiving, deleting. You don't do that, Thunderbird does.Very similar to using a stock broker. To answer your question, you respond to the prompt that Thunderbird is your agent. This happens regardless of email client used. If you deny, then you cannot access the account
creator: davidsk

content:
You have at least two choices...

1. Instead of clicking on a subfolder, right+click on the folder and use Open in new tab. Then close the tab when you are done with the subfolder. Or, don't close the tab but click on tab #1 which still has the Inbox folder.

2. use "[" key to go back through the message history - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/keyboard-shortcuts-thunderbird

content:
That smells like an IMAP account problem. True? If so, that is indicative of an IMAP error. My suggestion is to delete the index for the folder and let Thunderbird rebuild it. To get to the file, try these steps: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' - exit thunderbird - click the imapmail folder and then the account folder. - you should now see the files, e.g., inbox, inbox.msf. - delete the .msf file - restart Thunderbird and I hope you get past the error.

- Now to fix the sink, locate the johnson rod attenuator support panel, recalibrate the automatic reversal pipe regenerative process, stand back three feet, count to ten, and voila!, the sink will be emptied.

content:
If you are being asked to enter a Primary Password and don't have it, these steps should help, but if all fails, it may be simpler to start over a new install: 

Choose Tools -> Developer Tools > Error Console, paste the expression:    openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xhtml")     and press the Evaluate button. That will open a dialog asking you if you want to reset your password. If Evaluate is not seen, press enter key. When prompted, press the Reset button.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password#w_resetting-your-primary-password-if-you-have-forgotten-it
creator: davidsk

content:
You can't restrict to a "word". However, filter criteria operate the same as Edit > Find > Search. So I think you can do the next best thing with leading and trailing spaces, use "match any" with subject contains " ecam" subject contains "ecam " subject is "ecam"

Then I think there are is only one type of situation where a message won't be selected, when ecam is bounded by something other than a space character. Quote character for example.
creator: wsmwk

content: Just to make sure. Look in Tools -> Settings -> General and go to the Reading & Display section. Is View attachments inline checked/enabled? If not, then that might be the reason.

content: First, you will generally do better by limiting your posts to a single issue. I will comment on the threading issue. The official statement is at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird Using the config editor to change the default works, as Thunderbird will use that setting for all future folders. And the manual process of selecting a folder, and then using the menu option shown there will allow setting all folders within an account.
creator: davidsk
